### FET Biasing

#### Fixed Bias Configuration

![](_page_3_Picture_2.jpeg)

$$I_{G} \cong 0 \text{ A}$$

$$I_{R_{G}} = I_{G}R_{G} = (0 \text{ A})R_{G} = 0 \text{ V}$$

We assume: The voltage drop across $R_G$ is very low $\implies V_{GG} \cong V_{V_GS}$

$$-V_{GG} - V_{GS} = 0$$

$$V_{GS} = -V_{GG}$$

$$I_{D} = I_{DSS} \left(1 - \frac{V_{GS}}{V_{P}}\right)^{2} \qquad \text{Shockley Equation}$$

$$+V_{DS} + I_{D}R_{D} - V_{DD} = 0$$

$$V_{DS} = V_{DD} - I_{D}R_{D}$$

$$V_{DS} = V_{D} - V_{S}$$

$$V_{D} = V_{DS} + V_{S} = V_{DS} + 0 \text{ V}$$

$$V_{D} = V_{DS}$$

$$V_{GS} = V_{G} - V_{S}$$

$$V_{G} = V_{GS} + V_{S} = V_{GS} + 0 \text{ V}$$
